result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on March 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

DE must reside at the address provided.   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.

ADDRESS INFO for Cody J Bartels
Current: N3817 Bryant Rd, Bruce, WI 54819 United States  (Effective: 03-09-2022)
Prior: 1028 Newman St, Bloomer, WI 54724

10:57 AM Defendant Cody J Bartels in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case will belong to Ms Barna, ADA Nelson appearing for today only.  DE will waive any potential conflict.   Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE will waive PH.  Court instructs on waiver of PH.  DE understands waiver of PH, makes waiver knowingly, freely, voluntarily, intelligently, court will accept waiver of PH. Court will bind over. Atty Raymond would like to be heard on bond, believes DE has been sitting without a complaint being filed for 30 days, will be residing with his grandfather in Bruce, believes he will be able to go back to his job, has family in the area, asking for a $2500.00 sign bond.  Atty Nelson believes some cash is necessary, asks for $500.00 cash bond. 

 The court will order a $2500.00 sign bond, DE will reside at the address provided.    Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  Set for Arraignment March 22, 2022 @ 2:30pm. Adj 11:13am.
